snippet: Professor Huxley shared the 1963 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine for a breakthrough discovery that helped better understand the electrical stimulation of nerve cells.
abstract: Sir Andrew Huxley, Nobel-winning physiologist, dies at age 94.
lead_paragraph: Professor Huxley shared the 1963 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine for a breakthrough discovery that helped better understand the electrical stimulation of nerve cells.
